intro: Paradigma galeottiana, commonly known as the Galeotti's paradigma, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
